page.title: 09Education in Southwick.
page.content: There are many more chidren in Southwick than Rode and the playgroup meets every morning. Southwick C of E Primary School has about 180 pupils aged 5 to 11. The boys and girls come from Southwick, Trowbridge and North Bradley. There are 6 classes and a non-teaching headmaster. The Church of England is represented on the School Board and has influence on the school curriculum. Southwick is in Wiltshire, so the education policy differs widely from that practised in Rode, which is controlled by Somerset Education Authority. When children reach 11 they go to John of Gaunt Comprehensive School, Trowbridge until they are 16 or older. The admission procedure is also different at Southwick school; pupils start school in the term, rather than the year, in which they are 5.
